_comment: Created by ianb on 16/12/2014 11:19:08 using v2.3
title: How has the proportion of outpatients informed of who to contact in case of any concern changed?
analysis_commentary: The proportion of outpatients who reported not being informed of who to contact in case of any concern with their condition or treatment upon returning home increased from 62% in 2004 to 66% in 2011. In general the proportion of patients being informed of who to contact in case of any concern is lower in outpatient departments than inpatients.
data_source: Care Quality Commission, Survey of Adult Outpatient Services
